intro: Neuroloma arabidiflorum var. aspera, commonly known as the rough-leaved neuroloma, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its rough, textured foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and dry landscapes. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered vulnerable in some conservation assessments.
